identity.mission: Kill the boring 'white dashboard'. Bring the login page's dark energy to the core.

headings.usage: Page titles, Card headers, Big metrics

mono.usage: Data points, IDs, Status pills, Charts

GlassCard.description: The fundamental building block. Replaces all white cards.
GlassCard.styles: bg-white/5 backdrop-blur-xl border border-white/10 shadow-2xl shadow-black/40 rounded-2xl hover:bg-white/10 transition-all duration-300 group relative overflow-hidden
GlassCard.interactive_effect: Add a 'tracing beam' or 'glow' effect on hover.

StatsCard.description: Small metric cards with top border accents.
StatsCard.accent_bar: absolute top-0 left-0 right-0 h-1 bg-gradient-to-r from-primary to-purple-500

PageHeader.styles: mb-8 flex flex-col gap-2 border-b border-white/10 pb-6

PrimaryButton.styles: bg-primary hover:bg-primary/90 text-white shadow-[0_0_20px_rgba(99,102,241,0.5)] transition-transform hover:-translate-y-0.5 active:scale-95 font-medium px-6 py-2.5 rounded-lg

universal_guidelines: OVERWRITE /app/frontend/src/index.css variables to force DARK MODE by default. The light mode is dead.
Do NOT touch the sidebar structure, but ensure it blends with the new dark body.
Use 'backdrop-blur-xl' liberally. The background should feel like 'smoked glass'.
Replace all solid white backgrounds with `hsl(var(--card))` which is now transparent/glass.
Use `JetBrains Mono` for all numbers and data-heavy tables.
Ensure 'Chart' components use the new dark palette (Neon Blue, Purple, Emerald, Orange) instead of default colors.

implementation_steps.details: Modify /app/frontend/src/index.css :root to use the dark theme values defined in this JSON.
Create a global utility class `.glass-panel` in index.css that applies the glassmorphism styles (bg, blur, border, shadow).
Update the existing Card, Button, and Table styles in index.css to match the new dark aesthetic.
Refactor the main dashboard layout to use the Bento Grid strategy.
